Type: Beach / Uninhabited Island & Lagoon / Marine Eco-Tourism / Resort Island
Nearest Railway Station: None on island; nearest mainland railhead is Kochi Railway Station, approx ~400 km + sea transfer (via Agatti)
Nearest Bus Stand: Not applicable on island; mainland Kochi bus stands serve for initial travel.
Nearest Airport: Agatti Airport (Agatti Island) — Bangaram is ~12 km by boat from Agatti Airport.
Timings: Access largely daylight hours; resort stays operate year-round when weather permits. Sea and boat transfers depend on sea/weather. Not documented fixed “opening/closing” hours.
Entry Fee: Resort cost for accommodation; permit required to enter Lakshadweep (travellers must obtain permit via Lakshadweep administration) and charges for boat/sea transfer. Specific ₹ amount for entry Not documented.
Best Time to Visit: October to May — fair season, calm seas, good for water sports and diving. Monsoon period (approx mid-May to September) brings heavy rains & rough seas.
Accessibility: Reachable by flight to Agatti then boat; island is uninhabited so access limited to resort guests; no roads; walking on beaches only; no wheelchair infrastructure.
Guided Tours: Yes through resort operators / Lakshadweep tourism packages; water-sports instructors; snorkeling / scuba guides.
Parking: At Agatti Island for initial leg; Bangaram resort guests arrange boat transfers; parking not applicable on Bangaram itself beyond resort area.
Nearby Amenities: Resort cottages, restaurant at the resort; minimal infrastructure beyond that; supply from Agatti.
Special Notes: Known for phosphorescent plankton which glow bioluminescent at night; pristine coral reefs; one of the more secluded islands; unpolluted environment.

Type: Beach / Lagoon / Marine Eco-Tourism / Administrative & Cultural Centre
Nearest Railway Station: None on island; nearest mainland station Kochi (~404 km) plus boat/ship/flight transfer.
Nearest Bus Stand: Not applicable on island; mainland bus/terminal at Kochi.
Nearest Airport: Agatti Airport — then boat or ship / speed vessel / inter-island vessel to Kavaratti.
Timings: Beaches / lagoon activities accessible in daytime; water sports / aquarium etc operate by daylight; sea vessel schedules seasonal. Not documented exact hours.
Entry Fee: Permit needed to visit Lakshadweep; water-sport / scuba / glass-bottom boat / marine aquarium fees may apply; specific ₹ amounts Not documented.
Best Time to Visit: October to May - during fair season; avoid monsoon when lagoon rough and sea travel disrupted.
Accessibility: Well developed compared to many islands; has more infrastructure; beaches / lagoons easy; marine aquarium; snorkeling / diving; limited for mobility disabled (steps, boat-based transfers).
Guided Tours: Yes – PADI dive centre in Kavaratti; tourism packages; local guides.
Parking: On arrival at jetty / port area; limited; used mainly for foot traffic; no large vehicle parking on small island.
Nearby Amenities: Guest houses / tourist huts, restaurants, shops near main settlement; mosque / cultural sites (Ujra Mosque, Mohidden Mosque, etc.)
Special Notes: Admin HQ of Lakshadweep; many mosques including Ujra and Mohidden (historic); marine life rich; known for coral reef, glass-bottom boat rides; calm lagoons, water sports.

Type: Beach / Lagoon / Eco-Tourism / Water-Sports Hub
Nearest Railway Station: None on island; nearest mainland station Kochi plus sea/air transfer.
Nearest Bus Stand: Not applicable on island; mainland bus in Kochi.
Nearest Airport: Agatti Airport → then by boat/vessel to Kadmat.
Timings: Daylight hours for beach / lagoon / water-sports; packages schedule water activities; Not documented precise timings.
Entry Fee: Permit needed; water-sport hire fees; package pricing; specific ₹ amounts Not documented.
Best Time to Visit: October to May for calm seas and good visibility. Monsoon months rough and some services suspended.
Accessibility: Inter-island boat access; internal paths; island small so walking is feasible; limited facilities for people with mobility restrictions.
Guided Tours: Yes – scuba diving, snorkeling guides; tourism operators.
Parking: At arrival jetty / docking area; minimal.
Nearby Amenities: Tourist huts or cottages, eateries, basic shops; limited but sufficient.
Special Notes: Kadmat Beach awarded “Blue Flag” eco-label; excellent for snorkelling, coral reef, aquatic life; marine awareness programmes held here.

Type: Island / Cultural Heritage / Beach / Lighthouse / Eco-Tourism
Nearest Railway Station: None on island; nearest on mainland via Kochi plus transfers.
Nearest Bus Stand: Not applicable on island; Kochi / Kerala mainland.
Nearest Airport: Agatti Airport → then by ship/vessel to Minicoy or via inter-island vessels depending on schedule. Some package ships connect.
Timings: Beaches / lighthouse open during daylight; sea voyage / ferry/tour schedules; Not documented full hours.
Entry Fee: Permit required to visit Lakshadweep; lighthouse entry may allow tourist access; water-sport / village tour fees; Not documented amounts.
Best Time to Visit: October to May for favorable weather, calm sea; monsoon season (mid-May-Sept) less ideal.
Accessibility: Island travel via boats or ships; internal roads; for cultural/tourist village areas walking; limited infrastructure.
Guided Tours: Local guides for boat trips, lighthouse visits, village tours.
Nearby Amenities: Tourist cottages, local eateries, shops; markets; cultural performances.
Special Notes: Minicoy has distinct culture & language closer to Maldives style; famous lighthouse (built 1885) which flash every 15 seconds. Thundi Beach in Minicoy is eco-Blue Flag certified.

Type: Coral Atoll / Lagoon / Beach / Eco-Tourism / Water-Sports
Official Website: Tourism packages page of Lakshadweep; “Marine Wealth Awareness Programme includes Kalpeni”
Wikipedia: Pages on Kalpeni Island (info in travel guides / articles) — implied though specific-island page exists. Not documented strong separate wiki link in retrieved sources.
Nearest Railway Station: None on island; mainland via Kochi + sea/air transfer.
Nearest Airport: Agatti Airport → boat/vessel to Kalpeni.
Timings: Beach and lagoon accessible in daylight; Water-sports schedule governed by package operators; Not documented fixed opening hours.
Entry Fee: Permit required; water activity hire fees; Not documented specific ₹ amounts.
Best Time to Visit: October to May (sea calm, good visibility, full range of water sports). Monsoon less favorable.
Accessibility: Lagoon/reef access via boats; small island, walking; limited services; not fully accessible for those needing specialized mobility support.
Guided Tours: Yes – snorkeling, diving, kayaking guided by local operators.
Parking: At jetty / arrival docking point; limited.
Nearby Amenities: Tourist huts or cottages; small shops and eateries; basic facilities.
Special Notes: Scenic lagoons; less crowded compared to some islands; good for eco-tourism, tranquility; part of “Marine Wealth Awareness Programme”.

Type: Beach / Lagoon / Gateway Island / Eco-Tourism
Nearest Railway Station: None on island; nearest mainland Kochi (~460 km + sea/air transfer)
Nearest Airport: Agatti Airport (only airstrip in Lakshadweep) — within island
Entry Fee: Lakshadweep entry permit required; fees for water sports not fixed (Not documented)
Best Time to Visit: October – May (calm sea & flights operate regularly)
Accessibility: Flights from Kochi; internal travel by foot, cycle, jeep; island small & easy to explore
Guided Tours: Yes — diving, snorkeling, fishing tours available
Nearby Amenities: Resorts, restaurants, small shops, water-sports centres
Special Notes: Only airport in Lakshadweep; turquoise lagoon; main hub for tourists before moving to other islands.

Type: Coral Atoll / Cultural Island / Beach Destination
Official Website: Lakshadweep Tourism packages (Not documented specific page)
Nearest Railway Station: None; Kochi on mainland (~400 km + sea/air transfer)
Nearest Airport: Agatti Airport → ferry/boat to Amini (~50 km)
Timings: Daytime access; open year-round depending on sea conditions
Entry Fee: Permit required; no fixed ticket (Not documented)
Accessibility: Inter-island ferries; narrow village roads, mostly walkable
Guided Tours: Local guides for cultural heritage & handicrafts
Special Notes: Known for traditional craftsmanship (stone carving, walking sticks); historic significance in Lakshadweep’s Islamic heritage.

Type: Remote Island / Lagoon / Beach Destination
Nearest Railway Station: None; Kochi on mainland (~450 km + sea/air transfer)
Nearest Airport: Agatti Airport (~60 km by boat)
Accessibility: By boat from Agatti/Kadmat; limited infrastructure
Guided Tours: Rare; mostly eco-tourist stays arranged by government packages
Nearby Amenities: Very basic — few homestays, shops, medical aid
Special Notes: Historically known for coir rope making; calm environment; secluded, off-beat destination.

Type: Uninhabited Islets / Marine Bird Sanctuary / Eco-Tourism
Nearest Railway Station: None; Kochi mainland (~450 km + sea transfer)
Nearest Airport: Agatti Airport (~70 km, then boat ride)
Timings: Accessible during daylight via boat trips
Entry Fee: Part of tourist package fees (Not documented exact ₹)
Accessibility: Only via boat; no permanent settlements
Guided Tours: Organized by Lakshadweep tourism operators
Special Notes: Known for seabird colonies; excellent snorkeling & diving site; part of Kalpeni group.

Type: Remote Island / Cultural Village / Scenic Beach
Nearest Railway Station: None; Kochi (~480 km + transfers)
Nearest Airport: Agatti Airport (~100 km by boat)
Timings: Accessible via boat/ship; no fixed hours
Accessibility: By ship/boat only; limited infrastructure
Guided Tours: Limited; occasionally arranged by Lakshadweep tourism
Nearby Amenities: Very basic — a few homes, small shops; no hotels
Special Notes: Smallest inhabited island in Lakshadweep; population <300; has a shrine of Malik Mulla, a revered figure.

Type: Coral Island / Beach / Historic Trade Hub
Nearest Railway Station: None; Kochi on mainland (~400 km + transfer)
Nearest Airport: Agatti Airport (~60 km by boat)
Timings: Accessible during daytime, subject to sea conditions
Accessibility: Inter-island boats/ships; narrow village roads
Guided Tours: Local guides available for cultural tours
Special Notes: Famous for old Arab trade links; rich folklore & unique culture.

Type: Uninhabited Atoll / Diving Spot / Eco-Tourism
Nearest Railway Station: None; Kochi on mainland (~400 km + sea transfer)
Nearest Airport: Agatti Airport (~100 km by boat)
Accessibility: Boat trips from Kavaratti/Agatti
Guided Tours: Diving & fishing expeditions organized
Special Notes: Known for manta rays, tuna fish, and pristine lagoons; restricted for conservation.

Type: Historic Lighthouse / Viewpoint
Nearest Railway Station: None; Kochi (~400 km + ship/flight transfer)
Nearest Airport: Agatti Airport (~400 km, then ship to Minicoy)
Accessibility: Within Minicoy island; easily reachable by cycle or scooter
Guided Tours: Available with local packages
Special Notes: Built in 1885 by British; 300 ft tall; panoramic views of Arabian Sea.

Type: Beach / Luxury Island Resort / Scuba Diving Destination
Nearest Railway Station: None; Kochi on mainland (~400 km + transfer)
Nearest Airport: Agatti Airport (8 km boat ride)
Accessibility: Short boat ride from Agatti
Guided Tours: Yes — diving, snorkeling, turtle & dolphin watching
Special Notes: Popular honeymoon destination; one of the few islands where alcohol is permitted.

Type: Largest Island / Cultural & Religious Centre / Beaches
Nearest Railway Station: None; Kochi (~300 km + sea transfer)
Nearest Airport: Agatti Airport (~200 km away; boat/ship required)
Accessibility: Ships & ferries connect Andrott with Kochi and other islands
Guided Tours: Available with local packages
Special Notes: Houses tomb of Saint Ubaidullah; strong Buddhist history; rich marine life.

Type: Lagoon / Beach / Water Sports Destination
Nearest Railway Station: None; Kochi (~400 km + sea transfer)
Nearest Airport: Agatti Airport (~75 km by sea)
Entry Fee: Entry permit required; package charges vary
Accessibility: Ships from Kochi; ferries between islands
Guided Tours: Yes — water sports & local tours
Special Notes: Known for snorkeling, kayaking, glass-bottom boat rides; unique coral debris called Cheriyam Pitti.

Name of Place: Cheriyam Island (part of Kalpeni Atoll, Lakshadweep)
Type: Uninhabited Islet / Eco-Tourism Spot
Nearest Railway Station: None; Kochi (~400 km + transfer)
Nearest Airport: Agatti Airport (~70 km away + boat)
Accessibility: Accessible via boats from Kalpeni
Guided Tours: Only through local boat operators
Special Notes: Known for white sandy beaches, nesting seabirds, and peaceful solitude.

Type: Uninhabited Bird Sanctuary / Diving Spot
Nearest Railway Station: None; Kochi (~400 km + transfer)
Nearest Airport: Agatti Airport (~70 km away + sea transfer)
Accessibility: Boats from Kalpeni
Guided Tours: Limited; only with permission
Special Notes: Declared bird sanctuary; nesting site for terns, turtles, and rare migratory species.

Type: Uninhabited Islet / Nature Spot
Nearest Railway Station: None; Kochi (~400 km + transfer)
Nearest Airport: Agatti Airport (~20 km by boat)
Accessibility: Boats from Kavaratti
Guided Tours: Yes — small trips arranged locally
Special Notes: Famous for secluded beaches, picnic spots, dolphin sightings.

Type: Atoll / Diving & Fishing Spot
Nearest Railway Station: None; Kochi (~400 km + transfer)
Nearest Airport: Agatti Airport (~100 km by sea)
Accessibility: Special boat trips from Agatti/Kavaratti
Guided Tours: Available with diving/fishing operators
Special Notes: Famous for deep-sea fishing, coral reefs, and snorkeling adventures.
